table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Layer - is the layer number of the stream reach.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Row - is the row number of the stream reach.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Col - is the column number of the stream reach.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Seg - is a number assigned to a group of reaches. Segments must be numbered in downstream order and are read into the program in sequential order.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Reach - is a sequential number in a segment that begins with 1 for the farthest upstream reach and continues in downstream order to the last reach in the segment. Reaches must be read in sequentially because the order in which reaches are read determines the order of connection.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Flow - is the streamflow entering a segment. This value is used only for the first reach of each segment. The value should be specified as either 0 or blank when the reach number (Reach) is not 1. When the inflow to the first reach of a segment is the sum of the outflow from upstream tributary segments, Flow should be specified as -1. When the segment is a diversion, the Flow for the first reach is the amount to divert; however, there will be no diversion if the segment from which the diversion is obtained contains less than the value of Flow.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Stage - is the stream stage. The value of Stage is not used if
Stage is measured relative to the same datum as the rest of the model. It is
measured relative to the stream bottom.
